episodes.title: P. Diddy’s Long Days, Short Nights In Jail During Trial
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs is currently on trial for alleged sex trafficking and racketeering. The music mogul is being held in the Metropolitan Detention Center, also known as the MDC. Law&Crime’s Angenette Levy breaks down what P. Diddy’s life is like behind bars.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Preparing For Possible Comeback After Trial
episodes.description:
Sean “Diddy” Combs rose to the top of the music and fashion industry because he worked hard but he also knew how important marketing and good PR was in reaching his goals. Now Combs is on trial for racketeering and sex trafficking and is conducting a different type of PR campaign and it’s not the first time he’s been on trial. Law&Crime’s Angenette Levy talks with Combs’ former publicist in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: 9 Disturbing Details from P. Diddy's "Jane" About Sexual Trysts
episodes.description:
"Jane" is testifying under a pseudonym in Sean "Diddy" Combs' racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking trial. Jane testified she dated Sean Combs from 2021 to his arrest in 2024 but their relationship was not public. Jane said she fell in love with Combs but their relationship eventually turned into her having sex with male escorts in "hotel nights." The jury heard audio messages Combs' left for Jane and about infections she developed from the sexual trysts. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through the most shocking moments so far and how the jury is reacting in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Suge Knight Talks P. Diddy Trial in Bombshell Jailhouse Interview: 'Let Puffy Tell His Truth'
episodes.description:
Suge Knight, the founder of Death Row Records, is serving a 28-year sentence for voluntary manslaughter in a California prison. But that hasn't stopped him from talking about the RICO and sex trafficking trial of his onetime music industry rival, Sean "Diddy" Combs. Knight talks about whether Combs should testify, what the trial means for hip hop and the testimony. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy talks with Knight in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: 7 Tense Moments As P. Diddy Lawyer Grills 'Mia'
episodes.description:
The woman identified by the government as Victim #4 'Mia' returned to the stand Monday and was grilled by Sean Combs' defense attorney Brian Steel about her claims that Combs sexually assaulted her when she worked for him from 2009 to 2017. Federal prosecutors raised concerns that Steel was harassing Mia while Combs' team maintained their stance that Mia was showing a "false persona" to the jury. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through all of it in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: P. Diddy Defense Blasts Star Witness for 'Putting on a Show' in Trial
episodes.description:
Victim 4, who's been allowed to testify under the pseudonym "Mia", was on the stand for two days in Sean "Diddy" Combs racketeering and sex trafficking trial. Mia told jurors she was physically and sexually assaulted by Combs while working as his personal assistant. But Combs' attorney, Brian Steel, grilled her about old social media posts that showed her praising Combs and lead attorney Mark Agnifilo suggested Mia was putting on a show for jurors. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through Mia's testimony in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

A former assistant to Sean "Diddy" Combs testified using a pseudonym "Mia" that he physically and sexually assaulted her, kept tabs on her and used her to keep tabs on Cassie Ventura. episodes.title: 9 Key P. Diddy Witnesses Who Back Up Cassie's Disturbing Claims
episodes.description:
Cassie Ventura made a number of claims in her testimony about suffering physical abuse and forced participation in "freak offs." Combs' lawyers maintain the "freak offs" were consensual. But some witnesses have backed up Ventura's claims that she felt she had no choice to stay with Combs and to participate in the sexual encounters. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through the testimony of the witnesses who've corroborated Cassie's claims in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: 13 Explosive Moments in P. Diddy's Ex-Assistant Capricorn Clark's Testimony
episodes.description:
Capricorn Clark worked for Sean "Diddy" Combs a few times from 2004 to 2012 as a personal assistant and brand ambassador. She also worked as Cassie Ventura's manager. Clark saw a lot in her time and described an abusive work environment that included threats of murder, undergoing lie detector tests, and a kidnapping involving an alleged break-in at Kid Cudi's house in 2011. Clark said she also witnessed Combs beating Cassie Ventura. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy does a deep dive of Clark's testimony in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: 9 Wild Moments From Kid Cudi's P. Diddy Trial Testimony: 'What the F*&k!'
episodes.description:
Rapper and actor Kid Cudi testified in Sean "Diddy" Combs sex trafficking and racketeering trial about dating Cassie Ventura and his car being torched by a Molotov cocktail. Kid Cudi, whose legal name is Scott Mescudi, walked the jury through a break-in at his home that left his dog jittery and his interactions with Combs. At times, Mescudi had the courtroom laughing. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy discusses all of it with Elizabeth Millner and former federal prosecutor Neama Rahmani in this episode of Crime Fix  — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Baby Oil, Sex, and Costumes: P. Diddy's Stripper 'The Punisher' Tells All
episodes.description:
Sharay Hayes, the former exotic dancer who used the name "Punisher", is opening up about his experience with Sean "Diddy" Combs and Cassie Ventura. Hayes testified he was hired as a dancer by Ventura but when he showed up to the hotel, he was asked to participate in much more. Hayes said he took part in eight to 12 encounters with the couple that involved baby oil and sex from 2012 to 2015. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy talks with Hayes at length in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Inside P. Diddy’s Freak-Offs With Stripper ‘The Punisher’
episodes.description:
Sharay Hayes aka "Punisher" was an exotic dancer who got a call to put on a show in 2012 for a woman and her friends. The woman was Cassie Ventura and the meeting was actually a "freak off" involving Sean Combs, according to his testimony. Hayes detailed his meetings with the couple, how much he was paid and the baby oil placed around the hotel room. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through the testimony with defense attorney Paul Townsend in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.description:
Kerry Morgan testified about witnessing Sean "Diddy" Combs hit and push Cassie Ventura but she also said Combs turned his ire on her and choked her in 2018 and threw a wooden hanger at her head. episodes.title: 11 Shocking Moments in Cassie's Emotional P. Diddy Trial Testimony
episodes.description:
Sean "Diddy" Combs' legal team chose attorney Anna Estevao to cross-examine Casandra "Cassie" Ventura about her relationship with Combs and the "freak offs" the two arranged with male escorts. Estevao grilled Ventura about emails and text messages she exchanged with Combs, her willingness to participate in "freak offs", her claim that Combs raped her and a recording of her threatening to kill someone who claimed to have seen a video of a "freak off." Law&Crime's Angenette Levy goes through the details with criminologist Dr. Meghan Sacks in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: 5 Shocking Updates in Lori Vallow's Arizona Murder Trial
episodes.description:
Jury selection begins this week in the Arizona murder trial of "Doomsday Cult Mom" Lori Vallow Daybell. She's representing herself as she stands accused of conspiring to murder her estranged husband, Charles Vallow, for a life insurance payout. Vallow is trying to get the prosecutor removed from the case as the sheriff says she should wear a stun belt during the trial. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy has the latest in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Diddy's Ex-Girlfriend Cassie Fires Back at Rapper's Gag Order Bid
episodes.description:
Lawyers for Sean "Diddy" Combs have asked the judge presiding over his racketeering and sex trafficking case to issue a gag order preventing witnesses in the case from discussing it publicly. The move comes after a man named Courtney Burgess claimed he possessed videos of Combs engaged in sex acts with celebrities - including two minors - and that he testified in front of the grand jury. Cassie Ventura's lawyer, Douglas Wigdor, has asked Judge Arun Submaranian to deny Combs' request. Law&Crime's Angenette Levy looks at the issue in this episode of Crime Fix  — a daily show covering the biggest stories in crime.

episodes.title: Follower of Polygamist Cult 'Prophet' Admits to Transporting Young Girls for Sex
episodes.description: Moroni Johnson, a member of a polygamist cult led by Samuel Bateman, has pleaded guilty to federal charges related to his role in a conspiracy to transport girls across state lines for sex. Johnson faces anywhere from 10 years to life in prison when he's sentenced. Bateman, a self-proclaimed Mormon prophet, is expected to go on trial in September. Law&Crime’s Angenette Levy talks with cult experts Rick Alan Ross and Steve Hassan, PhD about the allegations in this episode of Crime Fix — a daily show that delves into the biggest stories in crime. If you’ve ever been injured in an accident, you can check out Morgan & Morgan. You can submit a claim in 8 clicks or less without having to leave your couch.
